Quiere incrementar su inventario para aumentar sus  ventas  ya que tiene  mucha demanda. Por lo que se presenta a ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para la compra de  frijol, azúcar, gaseosas, productos Avon, frutas  para la elaboración de refrescos naturales. Y poder invertir más en su negocio. De esta manera el se estaría ayudando mucho a salir a delante podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Isidro lives in the department of Masaya and is single.  He has gotten ahead through his business, which consists of selling Avon products door-to-door.  He also sells beverages from his home, and has 16 years of experience.  He comments that he has steady customers and tries to provide the best service possible so they will be satisfied with the product he offers them.  

He wants to increase his inventory in order to augment his sales, as he has a great deal of demand.  For this reason, he approaches Ceprodel to request a loan to buy beans, sugar, sodas, Avon products, fruits to make his natural refreshments and to invest more in his business.  This would help him get ahead and be able to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, sodas, fruits to make his natural refreshments, and Avon products.

loans.name: Dora Elisa Pupuche Soplopuco

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer de estado civil separada, con un hijo menor de 15 años de edad. Su domicilio esta ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, el cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz.
La actividad que realiza Dora es la comercialización de ropa en su domicilio y en las zonas aledañas, trayendo mercadería de Lima y comprando aquí camisas y pantalones en la época escolar. Es muy conocida en la zona y tiene clientela fija.
El monto del préstamo es de 3000 nuevos soles, que serán empleados para el transporte de mercadería desde Lima hasta Chiclayo para comercializarla en las zonas aledañas a su hogar. 
Dora ha logrado con su trabajo e inversiones mejorar su calidad de vida, costeando los estudios de su hijo y la construcción de su nueva casa.
texts.en:
Dora is a woman whose marital status is separated, and she has a child who is 15 years old.  Her home is located in the Olmos district, which counts on water and electrical services.  

The activity that Dora realizes is the sale of clothing from her home and in the surrounding zones.  She brings her merchandise from Lima, where she buys shirts and pants for the school year.  She is very well known in her area, and has a steady customer base.

The amount of the loan is for 3000 Peruvian soles, which she will use to transport merchandise from Lima to Chiclayo to sell in the areas around her home.  

Through her work and investments, Dora has managed to improve her standard of living and finance the education of her son and the construction of her new house.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothing.

loans.name: Genoveva Hernandez Juarez

texts.es:
Genoveva es una mujer de 40 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijas. Vive en casa propia con su familia. Dicho domicilio está ubicado en Caserío Cruce de Vega, en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande. Dicha casa cuenta con servicio de luz.
La actividad que realiza la titular es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino) y aves de corral, las cuales una vez alcanzado su tamaño y peso ideal, las comercializa en el mercado local. Su esposo es pescador de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana llega al domicilio.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 1400 nuevos soles, los cuales se destinarán a la implementación de un dormitorio más en el domicilio en el que residen.
texts.en: Genoveva is a 40-year old woman, married, and has 2 daughters.  She lives in her own house with her family.  Said home is located in the hamlet of Cruce de Vega, in the rural zone of the district of Tambogrande.  Her house has electrical service.  The activity that she carries out is the raising of small livestock (sheep) and fowl that, once they reach their ideal size and weight, she sells at the local market.  Her husband is a fisherman from Monday to Friday, returning to the household on the weekends.  The amount of the loan requested is 1400 Peruvian soles, which will be destined for the implementation of another bedroom in the house where they live.

loans.use: to implement an additional bedroom for her house.

loans.name: Alex Junior

texts.es:
Alex es un hombre de 25 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa de su abuela y su tío hace más de 15 años. Vive en el caserío Somate Alto, en el distrito de Tambogrande, exactamente en la zona rural y no cuenta con servicios básicos. 
La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la crianza de ovinos, en domicilio de su abuela, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace mas de 04 años y también cuenta con 1.0 ha de terreno agrícola , herencia de su padre, en el cual tiene sembrado plantaciones de limón en producción el cual cosecha y vende semanalmente. Además cuenta con negocio de venta de ropa, el cual recorre a los caseríos aledaños y tiene clientela ya establecida. Su abuela le brinda el apoyo necesario para su crecimiento económico.
El monto del crédito asciende a 1500 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para la compra de ganado y para la compra de mercadería (ropa) que se utilizará para la venta y comercialización.
texts.en: Alex is a 25-year old man, single, and does not having any children in his care.  He has lived in a home with his grandmother and uncle for more than 10 years.  He lives in the hamlet of Somate Alto, in the district of Tambogrande.  This is a rural zone, which does not have basic public services.  The activity that he carries out is raising sheep at his grandmother’s house, which he has been doing for more than 4 years.  He also has 1 hectare of farmland, inherited from his father, where he has lemon plants that he harvests and sells on a weekly basis.  In addition, he also has a business selling clothing door-to-door throughout the neighboring towns and has a well-established customer base.  His grandmother provides the support necessary for his financial growth.  The amount of credit requested is 1500 Peruvian soles, which he will use for the purchase of livestock and merchandise (clothing) for him to sell.

loans.use: to buy livestock to expand his business.

loans.name: Elenita Managing

texts.en: Elenita is married with three children. She is 42 years old and lives in Paiton, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she has a buy-and-sell cattle and goats business. She has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 10,000. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married with one child. She is 30 years old and lives in Malobog, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She sells pork barbeque to earn a living and has had this business for 6 months. Each month, she earns about PHP 1,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy pork for making barbeque. She became a member of PMPC this year.  In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy pork for making barbeque.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married with two children. She is 31 years old and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns about PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy groceries to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eufimia Bautista

texts.en:
Eufimia is 44 years old and lives in Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. She works in the fish industry and catches/sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 18 years. 

She has requested a loan to buy fishing supplies. She has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions by using profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies for her business.

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en:
Batmunh is a 59-year-old man who lives with his wife and a daughter in Bayanhongor province in Southwestern Mongolia. His daughter studies at the college. He has operated a taxi business since 2010. Also, he has been running a retail meat business with his wife. They bring the supplies from the herders in neighboring villages and sell them from a well-positioned shop counter at the local trade center. This has been the only financial source for the family and has been successful. 

He has a further plan to expand the business activity by buying the meats wholesale from the herders. Batmunh is a good-natured man who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by buying the meat in large quantities." The total amount he is requesting is 500,000 MNT to buy meat for the business.

loans.use: To buy meat.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean, a 33-year-old married mother of two, works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years she has run a sari-sari store in the Philippines, and also earns an income from buying and selling piglets.

Mary Jean has borrowed and repaid two previous loans from NWTF and is now requesting a new one for PHP 10000 to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. She aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Monica Pamela Ruiz Ramos

texts.es:
Mónica es una mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera y sin hijos. Vive en el domicilio de su madre ubicado en el sector de La Matanza. Mónica tiene buenas referencias laborales y personales. En el sector donde vive habitan más de 10000 habitantes y ella vive en un pueblo joven.
La actividad que realiza consiste en la venta de útiles escolares, venta de uniformes y de bebidas gaseosas, negocio que ejerce hace 3 años en época de escolaridad, osea, de febrero a abril.
El monto solicitado en el préstamo asciende a 1008 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán en la compra de útiles y uniformes escolares, puesto que tiene que entregar pedidos que están pendientes. Se propicia una buena época para la venta de este tipo de artículos porque a inicios de año, la demanda aumenta y crece la cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Mónica is a 24-year-old woman. She is single and has no children. She lives in her mother's home in the La Mantanza sector. Mónica has good personal and work references. The population of the sector where she lives is over 10,000. She lives in a young village.
Mónica sells school supplies, uniforms, and pop. She has had this business for over three years and runs it during the school season; February to April.
She is requesting 1008 Nuevos Soles, which she will use to buy school supplies and uniforms; she has pending orders to fill. She expects a good sales season because demand increases at the beginning of the year and her number of customers increases.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Vicente Anastacio Siesquen Garcia

texts.es:
Vicente es un hombre de 49 años de edad, casado y con 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia en el Caserío Punto Nueve, en la zona rural de Lambayeque. Cuenta con servicio de agua, la comunidad cuenta con aproximadamente 100 familias.
La actividad a la que se dedica es la comercialización de ganado ovino, ganado vacuno (vacas) y caprino dentro de su domicilio. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, de ahí se deduce que conoce a la perfección su rubro. Además, cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de sus cultivos de arroz.
El monto del préstamo solicitado es de 2000 nuevos soles, destinados a la compra de úrea para el abono de sus cultivos de arroz recién transplantado y para la compra de una vaquillona que ha sido ofrecida en oferta. Este negocio cuenta con competencia pero con poco inventario.
texts.en:
Vicente is 49, married, and has three children. He lives in his own home in the Punto Nueve hamlet, in the rural Lambayeque zone. His home has running water, and there are approximately 100 families in his community.
Vincente sells sheep, cows and goats from his home. He learned this work from his parents; he knows this job like the back of his hand. Furthermore, he makes an additional income from his rice crops.
The requested 2000 Nuevos Soles will be used for the purchase of urea to fertilize his recently transplanted rice crops, and for the purchase of a heifer which is on sale. This is a strong business, but it has little inventory.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops and to buy livestock.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en: Asuncion is a 49-year-old with 3 children who lives in Carangan, Ozamis City, Philippines. She has been sewing for 6 years and continues to do so. She designs dresses according to the customer's desired style, or sometimes she creates designs out of her own will and imagination. Every month, she earns 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which is enough to cover day-to-day expenses. Asuncion joined Gata Daku MPC earlier this year. She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 from the cooperative to buy sewing materials such as textiles and thread. By having all necessary materials, Asuncion hopes to create as much output as she can to generate more income. In the future, she plans to expand her business and/or buy another set of sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as textiles and thread.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old and married with three children. 

To make a living, Vergie runs a general store, selling a variety of food and household products in the local community. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Vergie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This year, Vergie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 45 years old and married with 2 children. Milagros is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Milagros has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Milagros would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. She is married and has has a food vending business in the Philippines for the past three years.

Nora has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Reyna

texts.en:
Reyna is 24 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like shampoo, groceries, and other items.

Reyna has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling gasoline.

Reyna aspires to save enough money to build a house for her family someday.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Las Preciosas Group

texts.es:
Olivia cuenta con 43 años de edad, es casada tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando Juana de 16 años esta en segundo de preparatoria y Jonathan de 10 años esta cursando sexto de primaria, su esposo se llama Nicolás es campesino.

Ella es comerciante vende frutas y verduras en la central de el puerto de Acapulco ya tiene 9 años con el negocio, lo cual invertirá en la compra de verduras y frutas como son: papaya, limón, melón, sandia, etc. Ella dice que le va muy bien con el negocio espera y le vaya mejor esta vez ya que esta sacando adelante a su familia y quiere incrementar el negocio.

Olivia pertenece al grupo las preciosas el cual esta integrado por 5 personas las cuales todas son mujeres trabajadoras y comprometidas con el trabajo y a salir cada día adelante a continuación serán mencionadas: Olivia, Ma Guadalupe, Elisea, Maria Bernabé, Brenda, todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: ferretería, productos de abarrotes, frutas y verduras, vulcanizadota, etc
texts.en:
Olivia is 43, married, and has two children who are in school: Juana, age 16, is in the second year of preparatory school; Jonathan, age 10, is in the sixth grade of primary school. Olivia's husband Nicolás is a farmer.
Olivia is a merchant; she has sold fruits and vegetables in the Puerto de Acapulco for nine years. She will invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables such as: papaya, lemon, melon, and watermelon. She says that the business is going very well and she hopes that it will improve with this loan. She is supporting her family and wants to expand her business.
Olivia belongs to the Las Preciosas group, which has five members, all hard-working women who are dedicated to their work and to getting ahead every day. These women are: Olivia, Ma Guadalupe, Elisea, Maria Bernabé, and Brenda. They each have a business such as: a hardware store; selling groceries; selling fruits and vegetables; a repair shop; etc.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables such as: papaya, lime, lemon, watermelon, etc.

loans.name: Teresita Llanera

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines, and she works hard to provide for her family. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, and other items.

Teresita has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Teresita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Virginia Pyponco

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Virginia works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling ice and juice. Virginia is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her prior 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan Banzragch

texts.en:
Bayarsaikhan is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (Mongolian yurt/nomadic tent) in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife changed her job and now works as a cook in a cafeteria while their two kids attend kindergarten. 

Since 2002, Bayarsaikhan has been running a taxi to support his family. He was trained as an engineer, but he still has not been able to find employment in his field. His business has been a main income source for his family for the past few years, as he explains. His wife’s monthly wage is not enough to provide the family's necessities. His car needs repair or renovation as soon as possible in order to continue his normal business operates. Core parts have been damaged, including an old engine and gear box, and its body is dated. Therefore he is requesting 1,200,000 MNT to purchase better spare parts and to cover his car renovation costs.

loans.use: To purchase better spare parts and to pay for the costs of renovating his car.

loans.name: Carlos Emilio Palacios Ruesta

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 69 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia ubicada en el caserío Monteverde Bajo en el distrito de Tambogrande. Carlos vive en la zona rural, pero cuenta con servicio de electricidad.
La actividad a la que se dedica Carlos es la agricultura, para lo cual cuenta con 1.20 has de terreno agrícola, de los cuales 1.0 ha está sembrada de mango Kent en producción y también cuenta con plantas de limón y cacao. Complementariamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, el cual al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local de su zona.
El destino del préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles es la realización de labores culturales en sus sembríos de mango, tales como poda, deshierbas y abonamiento. Carlos es un cliente conocido para la Edpyme Alternativa, ya que cumple puntualmente sus pagos y ya ha hecho préstamos a la entidad.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 69, is married and does not have any children under his care.  He lives in his own house in the Monteverde Bajo settlement in the Tambogrande district.  Carlos lives in a rural zone, but he does have electrical service.

Carlos is a famer.  He has 1.2 hectares of farmland.  He is growing Kent mangos on one of the hectares.  He also has lemon and cacao plants.  He also raises sheep.  When they reach the ideal size and weight he sells them at the local market in his zone.

He will use the 2,000 soles loan for agricultural work such as pruning, weeding, and fertilizing his mango crop.

Carlos is a known client of Edpyme Alternativa, has had loans with the organization, and has made his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and agricultural chemicals.

loans.name: Vivian Gaudiano

texts.en:
Vivian is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Vivian is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 51 years old and married with four children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and works hard to provide for her family. 

Yolanda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of merchandise to sell. Yolanda has borrowed and paid two previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 20 years and earns additional income from a restaurant.

Yolanda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of merchandise to sell

loans.name: Benito Juarez Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Benito Juárez esta conformado por once mujeres trabajadoras y  sencillas que se dedican diferentes actividades económicas una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Maria Esther de  veinte años de edad, ella  nos dice que se caracteriza como una  mujer trabajadora que le gusta  mucho  vender y  darle una mejor vida a sus hija  Dulce Maria de un años cinco meses.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Leonel de veinte años de edad es un señor trabajador quien la apoya en lo que necesite.
Doña Esther como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo se dedica a la venta de colchas, cortinas y cobertores por catalogo, ella nos dice que le gusta mucho su negocio por  que le deja buenas ganancias y así puede ayudar a  su familia.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de más  mercancía como  es: colchas cobertores y cortinas para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo.
Nos dice que gracias a su préstamo a podido  dar la primera parte para  que su mercancía le llegue a tiempo y así pueda tener sus pedidos  lo mas rápido posible y  sus clientes estén contentos.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Julia Isabel- quien se dedica a la venta de dulces.
Raquel- quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Virginia Genoveva -quien se dedica a la venta de  mercancía de abarrotes.
Cecilia Viridiana-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Dionisia Aurelia -quien se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Lourdes-quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Alba Agustina -quien se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Irma –quien se dedica a la venta de artículos  domésticos.
Brígida-quien se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Jovita Eulalia -quien se dedica a la venta de  comida.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudarlas que sus vidas cambien y así puedan mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: to sell bedspreads, curtains, and blankets through a catalogue.

loans.name: Anita Pizarro  De Risco

texts.es:
Anita es una mujer de 63 años de edad, es viuda y vive en casa propia. Vive en el caserío Cachinche, el cual está en el distrito de Mochumí. La mayoría de los pobladores de este caserío realizan venta de animales.
La actividad que realiza Anita es la venta de animales, la cual realiza en su domicilio y ya cuenta con clientela fija, además del servicio de costura, teniendo ya 3 años de experiencia. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura. 
El monto del crédito es de 3000 nuevos soles, el cual se empleará para la compra de más animales, los cuales serán comercializados luego, además de alimentos para ellos y para el mantenimiento de su máquina de coser.
texts.en:
Anita is a 63 year old widow, and she lives in her own house.  She lives in the Cachinche settlement, which is in the Mochumí district.  Most of the inhabitants of this settlement sell animals.

Anita’s business activity is selling animals, which she does at home.  She has a fixed clientele.  She also provides sewing services, and she has three years of experience.  Additionally, she farms.

The amount of the loan is 3,000 soles.  She will use it to buy more animals, which will later be sold.  She will also buy animal feed and pay for maintenance on her sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy livestock for her business.

loans.name: Anamie

texts.en:
Anamie is 47 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Anamie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a spice retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as onions, garlic, spring onions, and other items.

Anamie has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of spices to sell. In the future, Anamie would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of spices to sell

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is 25 years old and single. She works very hard to earn a living.

Evalyn runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, toothpaste, canned goods, eggs, and biscuits. 

Evalyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, and other items. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is from Puntod Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old and married with 3 children. To earn a living, she sells fresh fish while her husband catches fish. She has been in this business for 7 years and earns 1,500 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Alejandra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to repair their fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is from Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental Province. She is 43 years old and married with four children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a fishing business. She has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Nenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to buy another fish net. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy another fish net

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is from Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental Province. She is 30 years old and married. To make a living, Carmen owns and operates a fishing business. She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 1,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Carmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Carmen is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the needs of her family.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Entente Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENTENTE est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ayaba Germaine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ayaba Germaine est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Ayaba Germaine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Ayaba Germaine est veuve mais a un enfant scolarisé à sa charge. Ayaba Germaine vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer ses diverses charges, Ayaba Germaine vend depuis trois ans, de tissus à travers le système de distribution. Ayaba Germaine s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Ayaba Germaine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ENTENTE, un  crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group ENTENTE consists of three friends. The group’s representative is Ayaba Germaine, seen with her hand raised in the photo. 

Ayaba Germaine is 35 years old and she lives in Bénin. She never went to school. She is a widow with one dependent child who attends school. She lives alone with her child and she handles the household responsibilities on her own. 

In order to deal with the various family expenses, Ayaba Germaine started selling fabrics through the distribution system three years ago. She buys her merchandise in a city of Benin. 

Eager to achieve customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and revenue,  Ayaba Germaine is seeking a loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group ENTENTE.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Carmen Martinez Zapata

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 49 años de edad, es casada y cuenta con 4 hijos a su cargo. Vive en domicilio propio en el sector Valle de los Incas, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la zona rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz eléctrica.
La actividad que desarrolla Carmen es la venta de comida y chicha, negocio ubicado en propio domicilio, atendiendo los días viernes, sábados, domingos y lunes contando con clientela conocida. Esta actividad la desarrolla hace más de 6 años. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, terreno propio, en el cual tiene sembrado mango y limón que cosecha y vende semanalmente, generándole ingresos extras para apoyar a su esposa en sus obligaciones crediticias y canasta familiar.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 1200 nuevos soles, los cuales serán invertidos en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de chicha, tales como azúcar, maíz duro, así como para la compra de fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 49, is married and has four children under her care.  She lives in her own house in the Valle de los Incas sector of the Tambogrande district.  She lives in a rural area of the district, but she does have electrical service.

Carmen’s business activity is selling food and “chicha” (a corn based drink).  Her business is located in her own home.  She tends to her business on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays with customers whom she knows.  She has been doing this for over six years.

Her husband is a farmer, and he has his own land. He grows mangos and lemons, which he harvests and sells weekly.  He is generating extra income to support his wife with the obligations of the loan and with providing the family with food.

She is requesting a loan for 1,200 soles to buy supplies to make chicha.  She will buy things like sugar, hard corn, and fertilizers for their crops.

loans.use: to buy things like sugar, hard corn, and fertilizers for the crops.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 37-year-old resident of Kinuman, Ozamis City. She provides her 3 children's needs from the little amount of 3,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own banana production business, which she has operated for 5 years as an aid to the income gained from her husband.

However, this year she joined GDMPC, and she applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP at GDMPC micro-finance to buy young crops and fertilizer. Elisa wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy young crops and fertilizer.

loans.name: Marieta Ocampo

texts.en:
Marieta is 58 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

She has borrowed and paid off 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Marieta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is from Kinuman, Ozamis City. She is 33 years old. Ligaya is married and has 3 children. To make a living, she plants, harvests and sells bananas. For 3 years, Ligaya has worked at this business, and she gets about 2,500 PHP a month for these activities. 

She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizer. In 2011, Ligaya joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth, 37, is married and resides at Kinuman, Ozamis City, Philippines. She owns a plot of land where she plants bananas and then sells them for a living. She's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns about 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Recently, Maribeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Davaasuren Byambaa

texts.en:
Davaasuren is a 27-year-old woman who lives with her husband and a son in Uvs province in Western Mongolia. Her husband works as a teacher and their son is 4 years old. She works as a teacher at the secondary school. But in the summertime, from June to September, she has no job; therefore, she runs a garment retailing business. She has researched the business and planned all the staffing. Her sister is helping her to run the business successfully. She is importing the goods from China and selling them at the newly opened trade center. The products she imports provide many advantages and options for her customers. 

Davaasuren is a good-natured woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by buying the merchandise in large quantities and in different styles so that I can save for my son and improve our household." The total amount she is requesting is 1,800,000 MNT to buy garments.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en:
Dulamsuren is a 34-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 3 children in Bayanhongor province in Southern Mongolia. Her husband works as a security guard and  their two children attend high school. She moved to the town in 2002 after leaving her village, where she used to work as a herder. 

Based on her recent experience working at a shop counter, Dulamsuren started making embroideries and some traditional boots. She sells them at a shop counter at the trade center. Her work is always appreciated by the local customers. Dulamsuren is a talented woman who says, "I would like to expand my business activity by buying necessary materials for the embroideries from China so that I can create various types of embroideries in different styles." The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy the necessary materials from Erlian for the embroidery.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials for her embroidery business

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is a 37-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children in Bayanhongor province in Southern Mongolia. Her husband is employed and the children attend high school. 

Bayarmaa was trained as a hairdresser in 2000. Since that time, she has been working as an hairdresser, renting a shop counter in the trade center. In 2011, she changed and improved her workplace. She has a plan to further develop the business by having more supplies in the salon. Bayarmaa is a professional and hardworking person who says, "I would like to expand the business by buying supplies in different types, like more options for hair color and different shampoos and such." The total amount she is requesting is 300,000 MNT to buy salon supplies.

loans.use: To buy salon supplies

loans.name: Mugomere Group

texts.fr:
Antoine fait partie du groupe Mugomere,  il habite à Rumonge située dans la branche de Bujumbura.  Il est âgé de 30 ans et est marié à  Evelyne, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, âgés de 5 à 9 ans, tous étudient à l'école primaire. 

Il  est commerçant d’huile de palme depuis 1an.

Il est à son deuxième  crédit àTurame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter des bidons d’huile supplémentaires.Le total de bidons  obtenus, serviront à la revente, et lui permettront de gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait continuer le commerce en dehors de sa commune d’abord, et à l'extérieur du Burundi ensuite, grâce à l’augmentation des bénéfices.
texts.en:
Antoine is part of the Mugomere group. He lives in Rumonge, in the Bujumbura area. He is 30 years old and is married to Evelyn, a crop farmer. Together they have three children, 5 to 9 years old, all attending primary school.

He has been a trader of palm oil for one year.

This is his second loan in Turame. With the Kiva loan, he will increase his working capital and buy additional cans of oil. The whole lot will be used for resale, and thus enable him to earn more.

In coming years, he wants to extend his trading outside of his town at first, and then outside Burundi, as his revenue increases.

loans.use: Increase his working capital and buy additional oil cans for resale, to boost his earnings

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is a married woman with 6 children. She is 46 years old and resides at Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living, and she's been 2 years in this business. Each month, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy goods to sell in the community, like noodles, eggs, cooking oil and other basic daily needs. In 2011, Fedelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to build a house and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell in the community, like noodles, eggs, cooking oil and other basic daily needs.

loans.name: Togtohbayar Enebish

texts.en:
Togtohbayar is a 37-year-old man who lives with his wife and 2 daughters in the Sansar district of Ulaanbaatar. His wife works as a teacher at the secondary school. His children are students in secondary school and kindergarden. 

Togtohbayar has been running a transportation service since 2004. He serves as a driver for tourists. He is a professional and experienced driver who knows the roads well. He has a minibus named "Delica" that has 7 seats. But due to the bad unpaved roads in the countryside, the vehicle has broken down, and it needs to be repaired. Togtohbayar is a talented driver who says, "I would like to continue my business successfully by having my vehicle repaired." The total amount he is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to pay for vehicle repairs.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle repairs

loans.name: Celma

texts.en:
This is Celma, 55, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Carlito, a contractor. Along with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Celma operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals in the evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. She also sells ready-to-wear clothing for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Celma is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Celma hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mahougnon 4 Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON 4 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même maison et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Mévoto Emilie. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Mévoto Emilie est âgée 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Marcel. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Mévoto Emilie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer un mieux être à ses enfants, Mévoto Emile vend depuis cinq ans, des sacs de riz et des pâtes alimentaires par le système de distribution. Mévoto Emile s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Mévoto Emilie et les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON 4 sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt permettra certainement à Mévoto Emilie et à son groupe, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité par l’augmentation du stock de leurs produits et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Le premier crédit à été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Mahougnon 4 group consists of three people living in the same house and whose president (the one with the raised hand on the photo) is Mévoto Emilie. In order to increase their working capital, the group is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Mévoto Emilie is 37 years old and is married to Marcel. The couple has three children, all of whom attend school and are their dependents. Mévoto Emilie lives with her children and husband, and shares household expenses with her husband.

Over the past five years, to provide a better life for her children, Mévoto Emilie has been selling bags of rice and pasta through the distribution system. She resupplies in one of Benin's markets.

This is the second time Mévoto Emilie and other Mahougnon 4 group members have applied for loans from ALIDé. The loan will certainly enable the group to raise the level of their business activity by increasing the stock level of their products and increase their customer base and income. Their first loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice and pasta.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren is a 38-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in Bayanhongor province. Her two children study at secondary school. She has been running a meat retailing business since 2003, with help from her husband. Previously, she was a herder. She buys supplies from the herders and trades them in retail. She has made many regular customers who come to her shop counter to buy fresh meat. Dolgorsuren is a good-natured woman who says, "I would like to expand my business activity by purchasing meat in large quantities wholesale so that I can raise my income." The total amount she is requesting is 1,300,000 MNT, to buy meat.

loans.use: To buy meat.

loans.name: Julia Mercedes Garcia Centeno

texts.es: Julia Mercedes es una emprendedora a la que se le ha apoyado en el  crédito para que invierta en el negocio y aumentar su mercadería y la emprendedora nos expresa que sus clientes también aumentaron y que el servicio de costura es más demandado. Durante el financiamiento ha demostrado ser una persona perseverante y luchadora con ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente la emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para comprar telas, hilos, tijeras, agujas entre otros productos para la elaboración de los diseños.
texts.en: Julia Mercedes is an entrepreneur who has been supported through the loan to invest in the business and increase her merchandise. She tells us that her customers also increased and that dressmaking is the most demanding service. During the loan period she has shown herself to be a persevering person and a fighter with the desire to move ahead. Currently, she is asking for a loan to buy fabric, thread, scissors, needles, and other items to make her designs.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, scissors, needles, and other items to make her designs.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
This is Emelyn, 44, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Danilo, a driver, and a mother to her seven children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Emelyn operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sells them at a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy because of the low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy RTW brand products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Emelyn hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and draw her family closer to God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of RTW brand products needed in her business

loans.name: Clemencia Arintoc

texts.en:
This is Clemencia, 59, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Rodolfo, her business partner. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Clemencia operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more raw materials such as fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Clemencia hopes her business grows and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Purev Lhagva

texts.en:
Purev is a 44-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in the Tuv province of Mongolia. His wife is works at a kindergarten and his oldest child studies at college. Purev has been running taxi service business since 2009 and he supplies reliable service to his customers. He drives between the province and the capital city and has many regular customers in town. 

Purev is requesting a 1,100,000 MNT loan to replace some car parts. He says, "I would like to expand the business activity by replacing the motor and other parts which have been broken." In the future, he plans to expand his business and improves his household.

loans.use: to replace car parts

loans.name: Mahoulahoue Group

texts.fr: MAHOULAHOUE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Ahoéfa (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 28 ans. Ahoéfa est mariée à un certain Stan. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ahoéfa  vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Ahoéfa a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Ahoéfa mène comme activité la vente de produits divers et de tissus à travers un système de distribution depuis trois ans. Ahoéfa s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Ahoéfa sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe MAHOULAHOUE un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les  crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MAHOULAHOUE is a group composed of three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Ahoéfa (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 28 years old and married to a man named Stan. They have two children, both in school and in their care. Ahoéfa lives together with her children and husband and ensures, along with her husband, that the household expenses are covered. 

Ahoéfa halted her studies in primary school. To cope with her various expenses, she has had for three years a business selling a variety of goods and fabrics via the distribution system. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of responding better to the requirements of her burgeoning customer base and making more profit. Ahoéfa is requesting, along with the other members of the group MAHOULAHOUE, a third loan from ALIDé. The loans receive previously have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy cloth

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor is a 59-year-old widowed woman who lives with her son in the Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. Her son works as a builder for a private company. Since 2008, she has been running a second-hand retail store. Dolgor has been successfully running her business and her income has grown during this time. She has experience trading goods and before the upcoming season she purchases wholesale products so that her customers can buy the right clothes for the season. Dolgor is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by buying the supplies in large quantities in wholesale so that I could raise the income and save for my child." 

Dolgor is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy more spring garments at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy spring garments to sell

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
This is Lolito, 22, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Single, he manages the household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Lolito operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Lolito hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
This is Teresa, 46, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Isidro and is mother to their children. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresa oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Teresa dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit

loans.name: Twubake Ii Group

texts.fr:
Pascasie fait partie du groupe  Twubake II. Elle habite à  Bujumbura,  et a 30 ans.Elle est mariée à Viator, commerçant de boissons dans son bistrot. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant, âgé de  2 ans.
Elle a en charge 5 personnes dont 3 étudient.

Elle est  commerçante de brochettes de chèvre depuis 2 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital, en achetant d’autres chèvres de plus, pour vendre les brochettes, afin de gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  avoir un crédit plus important pour  développer son commerce,et parvenir à se construire une belle maison d'habitation.
texts.en:
Pascasie is a member of the Twubake II group. She lives in Bujumbura and is 30 years old. She is married to Viator, who sells drinks in a cafe. They have a two-year-old son. Pascasie has five people living in her care, three of whom are in school.

She has been selling goat kebabs for the past two years.

This is her second loan through Turame. With the KIVA loan that she receives, she will increase her capital by buying additional goats so that she can sell more kebabs in order to earn more money.

In the coming years, she would like to receive a bigger loan to expand her business and build a beautiful house to live in.

loans.use: to increase her capital by buying additional goats and selling their meat in order to earn more money

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en:
Enhtur is a 35-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in the Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. His wife works as a shop assistant and his children study at the local secondary school. Since 2006, Enhtur has been running a tire repair service and he provides reliable good service to his customers who appreciate his work. Enhtur is a hardworking and honest man who says "I would like to expand the business activity by buying the wheels in large quantities so that I could raise the income and improve the household."

Enhtur is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase wheels. In the future, he plans to expand his business and service center.

loans.use: to purchase wheels

loans.name: Jessan Gusto

texts.en:
Jessan, 26, is married and has 1 child. He is residing at Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

For a living, Jessan has been operating a fishing business for 3 years. Each month, he earns 5,600 PHP doing this type of business. He requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Jessan has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. 

In the future, Jessan wants to build a new house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en: Zeina is a 44-year-old single woman from Saida, who works in sewing to make her living. Zeina's work is going fine, and this is all because of her customers' trust and support. Zeina is a woman with a good reputation, who puts so much effort into pleasing others. To improve her business, Zeina requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary thread and textiles requested for her business. This is Zeina's eighth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good history in paying back her loans. She is very optimistic about her future loan, since all the previous loans had a positive impact on her.

loans.use: to buy necessary thread and textiles requested for her business

loans.name: Margarita Albrico

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years, and she also earns an income from farming vegetables. Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Margarita is requesting a 31,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets, paint, and other materials to repair her fishing boat. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, paint, and material to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Mahudjro Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDJRO est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom Maïmounath est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Maïmounath est âgée de 30 ans et vit au Bénin. Maïmounath a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Maïmounath est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Florent et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Maïmounath vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille, Maïmounath vend depuis six ans, des vêtements et des ustensiles de cuisine par le système de distribution. Maïmounath s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Maïmounath sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJRO, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group MAHUDJRO is composed of five persons who reside in the same district. This is the fifth time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé for boosting their business. The group's representative, Maïmounath, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 30 years old and lives in Benin. Maïmounath halted her studies in primary school. She is married to a retailer named Florent and is the mother of three children, all in school. She lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure the family expenses are covered. 

To help with the diverse family expenses, Maïmounath has been selling clothing and kitchen utensils for six years via the distribution system. She gets her supplies in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Maïmounath is requesting, along with the other members of the group MAHUDJRO, a fifth loan from ALIDé. The previous loan were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy clothing and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Exequiel Lopez Inga

texts.es:
Ezequiel es una hombre de 29 años de edad, casado y con 2 hijos como carga familiar. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el sector Valle de Los Incas, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Ezequiel vive en la parte rural de este sitio, por lo cual aún no cuenta con servicios básicos.
La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la ganadería, como porcinos y aves de corral, los cuales cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio (corral), donde al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los vende en mercado local. Esta actividad la desarrolla hace más de 6 años. También se dedica a la cosecha de limón y mango en parcela heredada. Su esposa lo apoya en todas sus actividades que realiza.
El crédito a desembolsar es de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales serán destinados para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de limón, para la deshierba y para el respectivo abonamiento.
texts.en:
Exequiel is 29 years old and is married with 2 children in his care. He lives in his own house, which is located in the Valle de los Incas area in the district of Tambogrande. Exequiel lives in the rural part of this place, so he still does not have basic services in his home.

He raises livestock, such as pigs and poultry, in the back part of his home (corral). When they reach the ideal size and weight, he sells them at the local market. He has been doing this work for more than 6 years. He also grows lemons and mangoes on an inherited piece of land. His wife helps him in all the work he does.

The loan to be disbursed is for 1000 nuevos soles, which will be used for the maintenance of his lemon crops, for weeding, and for fertilizing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his lemon crops

loans.name: Judith Castañares

texts.en: Judith is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old. Judith is married and has 3 children. For a living, Judith sells fresh fish while her husband does fishing. Judith has been in her business for a year and earns 2,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Judith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Judith is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair their fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to repair fishing boat

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 66 years old and married with six children. For the past 10 years, she has been farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Luzminda has received 19 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Luzminda is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Turazananye Group

texts.fr:
Amida fait partie du groupe Turazananye,  elle habite à  Bujumbura, et a 39 ans. Elle veuve, avec 5 enfants  âgés  de 6  à  16 ans. Tous étudient : les  deux premiers  sont à l’école secondaire et les autres au primaire.
Elle a en charge sa nièce qui étudie à l’université.

Amida est  coiffeuse dans son salon depuis 11ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit àTurame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  des mèches, des plantes,…à revendre, afin de gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années elle voudrait  construire sa maison de Bujumbura (kajaga).
texts.en:
Amida is part of the group Turazananye. She lives in Bujumbura and is 39 years old. She is a widow and has five children, from 6 to 16 years old. All of them are students: the first two are in middle school, and the others, in elementary school. She supports a niece, who is studying at the university.

Amida has been a hairdresser in a salon for eleven years. 

She is on her second loan with the microfinance institution Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and buy some hair extensions, braids… to resell to earn more.

In the next few years, she would like to build a house in Bujumbura (Kajaga).

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and braids to resell

loans.name: Gloire A Dieu Group

texts.fr: GLOIRE A DIEU est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Déli Jocelyne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans. Déli Jocelyne est mariée à un certain François. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Déli Jocelyne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Déli Jocelyne a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire, puis a appris la coiffure. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Déli Jocelyne mène cette activité de coiffure depuis quatre ans. Déli Jocelyne achète ses produits de coiffure dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Déli Jocelyne sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe GLOIRE A DIEU, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
GLOIRE A DIEU is a group composed of three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Déli Jocelyne (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 32 years old and married to a man named François. They have two children, both in school and in their care. Déli Jocelyne  lives together with her children and husband and ensures, along with her husband, that the household expenses are covered. 

Déli Jocelyne  halted her studies in secondary school, then she learned how to style hair. To cope with her various expenses, she has been in this business for four years. She purchases her hair products in a city in Benin.  

With the goal of responding better to the requirements of her burgeoning customer base and making more profit. Déli Jocelyne  is requesting, along with the other members of the group GLOIRE A DIEU, an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Rancho Los Herreros Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se  llama Rancho los herreros esta  conformado por  once mujeres trabajadoras que se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas.
Las integrantes  de este grupo viven en un rancho llamado las Herreros que esta ubicado en un pueblo llamado rancho  Viejo  donde hay muchas  papayas y árboles de mango.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Ciria una señora humilde de veinte año años de  edad que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como es: tacos dorados, empanadas de pollo, tostadas, sopes y quesadillas.
Ella nos dice que le gusta mucho cocinar y darles una buena atención a sus clientes ya que a ellos les gusta su comida.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Ermilo de treinta años de edad quien se dedica a la siembra de papaya tiene  un hijo llamado Pedro Jesús de siete años de edad quien cursa primer año de la primaria.
Ella nos dice que va utilizar su préstamo para la compra de más  ingredientes para la elaboración de comida como es: chile verde, chile seco, tomate, cebolla, ajo, queso, pollo, maiz para la elaboración de tortillas y quesillo.
Nos cuenta que también se dedica a bordar    ya hace servilletas y manteles para la venta.
Esta muy contenta  por el apoyo que le  ha dado fundacion  para que pueda mejorar su negocio.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Olga-quien se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Florencia-quien se dedica a la venta de pan.
Febronia-quien se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Paulina-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Agustina-quien se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Francisca –quien se dedica a la venta de pan.
Micaela-quien se dedica a la venta de pan.
Carmen-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Margarita-quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Elena-quien se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
 
Le da las gracias a fundacion por ayudara a las personas humildes que tiene deseos de salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida  de sus hijos.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima - Jauja Group

texts.es:
La Sra. MARLENI DORIS de 34 años de edad, madre soltera con hijo, actualmente es socia en la alcancía comunal “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA - JAUJA” grupo conformado por 8 personas. 
MARLENI DORIS se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos, realiza sus ventas a  pedidos y a su vez vende comida los fines de semana, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación obtuvo mejores ingresos económicos. 
El préstamo solicito para la compra de  nuevo productos cosméticos como cremas, perfumes, etc.  Sus objetivos para el futuro son comprar su automóvil.
texts.en:
Marleni Doris, 34 years old, is a single mother with a son. Currently she is a member of the "Santa Rosa de Lima - Jauja" communal bank, which is made up of 8 people.

Marleni Doris sells cosmetics. She makes her sales by taking orders. She also sells food on the weekends. Thanks to her effort and dedication, she obtained a better income.

The loan requested is for the purchase of new cosmetics such as creams, perfumes, etc. Her goal for the future is to buy a car.

loans.use: to sell cosmetics

loans.name: Jubilee Group

texts.en: This is 59-year-old Showa from Machipisa, one of the oldest high-density suburbs in Harare. She is married with four children, three of whom attend school. She also cares for one dependent. Showa runs a retail business selling clothes and blankets. Showa has been in this business for 11 years. She has requested a loan of $400 to buy more clothes and blankets for resale. With the extra income from this loan, she will be able to provide for the upkeep of her family. She says the main challenge she faces is clients who do not have much disposable income due to our economic downturn. In the future, Showa plans to diversify into general grocery sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes and blankets for resale

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 58 years old and married with five children. For the past 17 years she has been running a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Lucia also earns an income from raising livestock. She works hard to provide for her family.

Lucia is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of items and repair her store. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and repair her store

loans.name: Gladys Kahai Makori

texts.en:
Gladys is a 52-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of six and 27. She is married to a businessman. Gladys runs a general store where she sells items such as maize, beans, cosmetics, hair oil, and other items. Her store is within a busy market. Gladys also works as a farmer to increase her income and support her family's needs. Her major business challenge is the poor road network in her operating area and the low purchasing power of her customers.

Gladys is requesting a 100,000 KES loan to buy a motorbike to distribute her goods to her customers. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to wholesale and her dream is to buy a pickup truck to help distribute her goods.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to transport her products

loans.name: Soussou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SOUSSOU est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sèna Grâce Christiane est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sèna Grâce Christiane est âgée de 24 ans et est mariée à un frigoriste nommé Eric. Sèna Grâce Christiane a très peu fréquenté l’école. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est à leur charge. Aucun des enfants n’est encore scolarisé. Sèna Grâce Christiane vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant à charge. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Sèna Grâce Christiane vend depuis un an, des vêtements, des produits de beauté et des liqueurs de façon secondaire. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Sèna Grâce Christiane s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sèna Grâce Christiane sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SOUSSOU, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group SOUSSOU is composed of three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Sèna Grâce Christiane, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 24 years old and is married to a refrigerator specialist named Eric. 

Sèna Grâce Christiane has had very little schooling. The couple have two children, one of whom is in their care. None of the children have had schooling yet. Sèna Grâce Christiane lives together with her husband and dependent child. The couple share in the different household expenses. 

To help with the different needs of the family, Sèna Grâce Christiane has been selling clothing for a year and beauty products and liquor secondarily. This business enables her to support herself without much difficulty. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and increasing her sales and her revenues, Sèna Grâce Christiane is requesting, along with the other members of the group SOUSSOU, a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy clothing and beauty products

loans.name: Silvia Aguilar Bravo

texts.es:
Silvia desea ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, para ello necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca, específicamente para la  producción de leche y  vender  productos lácteos a los vecinos de su comunidad. En su caso en particular, producirá queso, natilla y otros derivados. Silvia considera que gracias a este  proyecto, podrá mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de su familia.

Actualmente Silvia desea obtener un microcrédito por ¢600.000 (seiscientos mil colones), para comprar una vaca y así poder incrementar los ingresos familiares. Ella sabe que esto será lento pero se esforzará para ir teniendo más animales y creciendo en producción. 

Silvia forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunalde El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito y dice que con el espera poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos
texts.en:
Silvia wishes to help her husband with the household expenses.  To do this she needs the loan to buy a cow.  She will buy the cow for milk production and for selling dairy products to the neighbors in her community.

She will produce cheese, custard, and other by-products.  Silvia believes that, thanks to this project, she will be able to little by little improve her family’s living conditions.

Silvia currently wishes to get a small loan for 600,000 colones to buy a cow.  That way she will be able to increase the family income.  She knows that this will be slow, but she will endeavor to keep getting more animals and increasing her production.

She is a member of the El Sauce communal bank of Santa Teresita Turrialba, one of the hundred member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and she hopes that it will enable her to continue growing as a businesswoman.  She also hopes to help her husband with the expenses.

She also emphasizes that thanks to these types of organizations and ways of facilitating loans, she gives her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to produce cheese and custard.

location.town: El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba

loans.name: Marlen Janet Betancourt García

texts.es:
